meanings.definition: To count again and calculate the total.
meanings.sent1: I will be retotaling the coins to make sure I have the correct amount.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to retotal their scores on the test.
meanings.sent3: After retotaling the votes, the election results remained the same.
meanings.sent4: She kept retotaling her expenses, hoping to find a mistake.
meanings.sent5: The detective spent hours retotaling the evidence to solve the case.

meanings.definition: The act of recounting and adding up numbers.
meanings.sent1: The retotaling of the inventory revealed a discrepancy in the records.
meanings.sent2: We had to do a retotaling of the expenses to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The retotaling of the votes turned into a tedious task for the committee.
meanings.sent4: The retotaling of the budget was necessary to finalize the financial report.
meanings.sent5: Her retotaling of the receipts showed a mistake in the calculations.
